review: I loved EverQuest when it launched - it was so much fun to play, the first MMORPG of it's kind.  Unfortunately, my nostalgia for the game wasn't enough to make it worth going back to when I tried it recently.  Between terrible graphics and clunky gameplay, I was on the fence, but crashing every single time I cast a spell was an annoyance too far.  Still, it was a lovely game back in the day and if it didn't crash so often, I might have revived my old characters.

review: This game has been going on for 23 years. This is an impressive feat for an MMO. EverQuest literally set the standards that you now see in MMOs today, This MMO was my first REAL MMO, it was also my first love when it comes to MMOs, while I may stop playing for a while here and there, I've ALWAYS come back to EverQuest, it is also the game which I hold all other MMOs in it's genre up to. And I have to say, even today, a lot of MMOs just can't offer what this classic can in content, rich story, and it is easy to pick up and just play

author: {'steamid': '76561198023714891', 'num_games_owned': 3265, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 187709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55270, 'last_played': 1709028476}
review:
Если очень-очень кратко: для русскоязычных игроков есть свой крохотный [url=https://discord.gg/xmkzZHCkVU]Discord-сервер.[/url]

В самой игре жду всех на сервере [b]Firiona Vie[/b], моё имя в игре Pumpking.

+ : игра всё ещё живая, новый контент выходит постоянно; больше четырёх тысяч достижений; бесплатно можно играть и наслаждаться квестами и лором достаточно долго, легко найти гильдию, в которой будет очень уютно находиться, играть и общаться; нет никакого pay-to-win (но есть, как говорится, нюанс). Это игра с богатой историей, которая продолжает жить.

- :  эта игра, которой на момент обзора 24 года со всеми вытекающими: геймдизайн иногда хромает, к интерфейсу и некоторым механикам привыкнет далеко не каждый, всё в игре на английском, так что многим будет тяжко. Как ни крути, это f2p-игра, и это значит, что игра всё равно будет склонять к трате денег. Если не брать необязательную косметику, то здесь траты ограничиваются покупкой подписки, которая убирает ряд ограничений и позволяет герою стать ощутимо сильнее, чтобы стать полезным в группе и рейдах.

Всех ждём, всех научим, пишите письма!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007454905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1646079244}
review:
The gold standard in MMO gaming and used as a template for countless MMO games since it was released in 1999. It was a harsh, brutal world in the beginning and has morphed into a care bear version of itself, with countless convenience features available for real money. That's the divider; when people speak of this game with passion, it's because of the deep imprint that hard games make on the player.

There's no game out there today with more content, more complex mechanics and a more passionate fan base. If WOW is the pinnacle of your mental gaming ladder, then don't bother; EverQuest will kick your butt and spit you out, leaving you complaining about the graphics and whatnot.

If you're honest and open minded about letting EverQuest expanding your gaming world, you basically have 3 options:

1. Play EQ Live, where most toons are max level with raid gear and PL their new toons to max, leaving few to group with while levelling (to the max level, which is 120 when this is written).

2. Start on a Time Locked Progression (TLP) server, that opens up expansions one at the time over 2 years. It has a more social player base, and many are experienced EQ players. The best new comer experience.

3. Start on Project 1999 (P99); EverQuest servers aiming for the authentic experience from 20 years ago, will never go past  the 2nd expansion (Velious) in what most die hard fans consider the "golden trifecta" of EverQuest (base game +2 expansions). It has a smaller player base in a smaller gaming world, the experience resemble what got most people hooked in 1999.

EverQuest (atleast TLP and P99) is one of the very few games in existence, where Pickup Groups (PUG) is not a curse word. While leveling you will certainly run into some bad eggs, but most people will be friendly and happy to help out new players. This is countered by the fact that  EverQuest today have no real newb mode, where new players are protected from the sheer complexity that is the EverQuest universe.

This has the effect that the player base in EverQuest in 2022 consist of mostly seasoned veterans, either from years of playing or returning to the game. There are new players and while the player base is friendly and helpful, the game itself is not really new player friendly.

If you're lucky enough to have a friend able to guide you into EverQuest, don't miss the opportunity, Just don't let them PL you too far, learning your class as you progress is how the game was designed and dungeon crawling a _slightly_ to hard dungeon with a group of friends is where EverQuest really shines. Most dungeons are unique and some are deep enough to require more than one night of exploring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074305321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 46887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14058, 'last_played': 1691299459}
review:
If you're getting this, the odds are you know what you're getting. It's an MMO that traces back to 1999, with roots a few years before in dev. You're playing it because you want that retro experience or more likely you played it in the day. If you're in that group... well you know what you're getting, and you're getting it exactly for it.

For me, the deciding point was the progression locked servers, especially the permanent locked one or two. A true, locked, 'classic' experience, that will never move forward. I can play for several months, life can get busy, I can come back, and I've lost virtually no ground. A game for those of us that are grown ups with responsibility now, but who once loved this when we had more time. No more chase the expansion. Dang right they got my 15 a month. (LoL plus a few bucks for a perk)

So this is what it is. A great game for people with long time memories, for players who seek a retro experience, and if you're not in that group you weren't looking at it and if you are, you're home.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024847808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 23106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22714, 'last_played': 1698260926}
review:
Come for the memories, stay for the nostalgia.

I started back in 99' and have well over 2000 hours into it aside from Steam, it's fun to pop back in on from time to time and just re-visit old zones and listen to the music.

Wouldn't invest a ton of time into it with it's current state, but fun to play casually. If you listen closely, you can hear the sound of milking in the distance, because that's all it is now. A cash cow, on it's last leg, trying to drain the IP. It's a shame they never re-created the experience with a newer version (cancellation of EQ Next was a disappointment), EQ2 is fun but it's not the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116879965', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 6891, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1642187308}
review:
Welcome to EverQuest ® - the online game that started it all! No other MMO matches EverQuest's sheer content, now with 25 expansions and countless updates. EverQuest is free-to-play.

Now in its unprecedented 19th year, EverQuest continues to add immersive gameplay, captivating storytelling, and exciting worlds full of mystery, fantasy, and adventure.

Join a thriving, dedicated community, immerse yourself in hundreds of unique zones, battle thousands of creatures, and complete exciting quests. Group with friends and experience an online game the way it was meant to be: epic, legendary, and together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026565056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1641965055}
review:
|MMO Try-Outs Review|
EverQuest is a 20 year old fantasy mmo. Having played only the tutorial, I'm not really sure about any of the story other than we escaped a prison. The graphics are not that bad for a 20 year old game, I've played a couple of MMOs that are younger than this that have worse graphics. The character creation was okay. Plus this is the first mmo that lets me play as a frog girl, which I'm still not sure why I was so excited but hey it was very cool. Also, It has a ton of race and classes to pick from for free. The UI is a big turn off for me. There's so much text on the screen that I get lost in it. Forming a party wasn't that hard, and it actually had a tutorial for that. It's surprising that it stuck around for so long and it has a multitudes of expansions. One thing that did annoy me a bit was a "Became a Member" add would pop up in the middle of what i was doing once in a while. I won't keep playing it, but it's not a bad game. And I give this a 6/10.

MMO Try-Outs Video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ua1RYbZ6UB0

author: {'steamid': '76561198174804359', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2179, 'last_played': 1642356107}
review:
THIS WILL HAVE TWO PARTS PVE AND PVP.

PVE
so i got the game. make a toon it has 1,2,3,4, pages of making one. then time to give it a name. name i want is taken ok but... it backs me out to page 1 and i have to repick everything for my toon again. this took like 15m as i really wanted a variant of that name. so now i get to long into game. befor i even move using w,a,s,d, i fall thro the floor of the viking area into water. ok its a new game so i relog get back into game now i am on a floor and i am able to use w,a,s,d, and read all the tool tips. now this part of the game i loved the graphics looked good, sound was great. i leave the main town i am atked by and npc right near the exit of the main town. i ran not knowing what lv the npc was and the town guards killed it. the controls are close to mount and blade warband and so is combat. i join a guild all nice guys and gave me a few tips. also i read a bit about the game befor i got it so i would know how to spend my str, dex, hp, points. so i was told i should go at lv 1 and kill lv 1-9 npcs near town i did but i found a lv 23 when i was only lv 2. i was able to kill it and i had 75% or so of my hp left. only do this if you are good at mount and blade warband as the exp is well worth it. so imo pve is great

PVP
ok so i goto a town with pplz from my clan we atk said town it had no players that i could see. a few npcs. we break a few gates with our spears and swords and take said town. i get paid for helping kinda like a mini quest i guss. then i goto a tournament where if you die you lose nothing ok great good way to get exp and test my skills. haha lol. its 19 vs 21 we had the 21. so its what team can get more kills in say 10m. its was 13 to over 100 near the end of the tournament my side lost. the lag i went thro was bad. i would be hitting someone and think i am doing great next thing i knew i was on the floor dead while the person i thought i was atking had little to no dmg. so imo PVP needs a lot of work befor its worth anything and since its the main part of the game well to me anyways i would say wait to get this game till they fix lag also i would say game is worth as is 10.00-15.00 so wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011584164', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1752, 'last_played': 1654443664}
review:
A classic, still fun to this day. The TLP servers in my opinion are a great alternative to p99, you get something close-ish to the original experience but with some really nice quality of life features thrown in (though the population drops in early zones are real after maybe a couple of months.) The live servers like Firiona Vie are fun as well and you can find some really good communities, but again, most people are either in the 50's or 60's up to endgame, so you will be soloing with mercs until you get to that point. The payment systems are fair, Krono is cool because much like EVE you can earn your way into a sub. 

Everquest also has something special - a beautiful soundtrack. Do yourself a favor and turn off the combat music after hearing it maybe once? It's pretty redundant. Luclin has some of the most beautiful music in a game period. EQ is absolutely a grind, and can be a lonely one, but if you find a good guild it can be a great social experience. It just has a certain charm that has not been made obsolete, although many many games came after it, and it lies in the simplicity - sit and grind in a camp. It is boring - with the wrong people. But it can be absolutely a blast with a good group.

Highly recommend but know what you are getting into!! Learning curve feels very very high at first, and is in many ways, but the live servers offer great tutorials, and a nice string of accessible zones. Not to mention PoK access right away which makes traveling the breeze. EQ has a very...unique...balance. You will learn that some mobs hit harder than others, take more damage than others, and that inspecting them and finding out their level and challenge is really a guideline - you will often be fighting reds and yellows, until you won't - gearing is important but with Defiant gear all over the place, is pretty easy to keep caught up on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010993430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2368, 'last_played': 1700865673}
review:
EDIT:  I put in THOUSANDS of Hours playing over the course of 20 years. Before Steam even existed I'm assuming. The hours it states here are only the hours I've played here and there through Steam after officially adding EverQuest to my library.

 
My Review and Thoughts on EverQuest:

EverQuest was the beginning of something amazing in my life. I had heard about it in 1999, but I didn't buy it until 2000 when the Kunark expansion came out. It was my first MMORPG and it blew my mind. The fact that I was seeing my friends on my screen and we were running around together was incredible. That we could group up and tackle the content was amazing. Back then, the pace was very slow. Meditating for mana was incredibly slow, mob spawns in many places were 28 minutes apart. It was so much fun, though. It gave everyone time to interact and get to know each other in the group. Discuss tactics and talk about other content that we had experienced or wanted to tackle someday.

The game itself has changed a lot over the years to say the least. The game is 22 years old for crying out loud. Of course it's going to change. Over time, especially after WoW was released, they began making the game easier and easier, and allowed for a faster pace. At the time, we grumbled about it, but I see now that it was just a natural process.

If you have never played, I highly recommend you do. It's incredibly easy to gear up now. The content isn't nearly as difficult and soul crushing as it was 20 years ago. It's a very fun game. But don't go looking for an experience that you're familiar with. This is an entirely different type of game and it will take some getting used to in regard to setting up hotkeys and learning the spell system. It's not complex really, it's just different.

You always start in the Mines of Gloomingdeep now, which is a good thing, as it contains a wealth of information for new players via the tutorials. If you're new to the game, I highly recommend that you slow down and actually read the information. In the long run you'll be much happier. The game really opens up and gaining power increases the fun level immensely. So I hope you'll have the patience to stick it out, at least get out of the Mines. Start your quest to become great. Joining a Guild is always a good idea, and there are global chat channels, including New Player chat channels that can help you along when you're stuck or confused.

I always return to EverQuest. I know that a large part of it is because it was my first MMORPG and I sort of grew along with it, even though I was in my early 20's when it was released. It's a different game now in many ways, and you can zip around the world using the Plane of Knowledge. 

If you're on the fence, give it a shot. A real shot. Commit to getting through the first 10 or 15 levels. You may find that EverQuest is game you had no idea you were yearning for.

Anyway, those are my thoughts on the game. Ramblings mostly, but I hope it helps.

- Acidon

review: 我一位已故的朋友，以前是SEQ的专业户，ID:Freshmen，矮人牧师，已经拿到EPIC了(俗称click)，20年前他一直想拉我进EQ，奈何我那时没有信用卡，没办法买月卡玩，所以只能干瞪眼的看他在那边打龙、打暴风巨人、甚至是看过他出[图耐尔]的raid，可惜只看到集结那边...说了这么多铺垫，是因为我现在玩这游戏，纯粹是怀念跟他在那边鬼混的日子，可惜这游戏现在的经营，所托非人...。内容还是差不多就那样，但是整体的经营环境已经完整变质为大型MPS(Many Person Single )ORPG...唯一可取之处在于...它是免费的，我人在台湾区连想储值都不给用台币转美金的方式储值。说真的，他如果还在，看到之前花的那些月卡钱，应该会干的死去活来吧。哎...

review: It's the original major MMO. Many server types to choose from and the game has a pretty friendly community that still plays.  I've played off and on since March 1999 and it holds a special place in my heart. There are too many memories to list in a review, but they're all great and I can remember them like they were yesterday.  If you like MMOs then EQ is a great MMO once you've learned how the game and UI operate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996202739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 53247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23214, 'last_played': 1700080604}
review: En el mundo del EverQuest, el jugador explora un mundo que recuerda al creado por Tolkien un mundo de fantasía, con espadas y magia, luchando con monstruos para conseguir tesoros y puntos de experiencia mientras interaccionan con otros jugadores. Cuanto más avanzan los jugadores, suben de nivel, ganando poder, prestigio y habilidades. También pueden conseguir objetos para sus personajes de muchas maneras, matando monstruos (y recogiendo el drop que éstos llevan), llevando a cabo quest (que les son procuradas por npc). Hereda gran parte de su estructura y reglas del famoso juegos de rol (Dungeons & Dragons).

author: {'steamid': '76561198095917598', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 1794, 'playtime_forever': 3427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1674207835}
review: More like ForEverQuest, this game will never die. Even though this game is dated, there is still a lot of fun in it. They keep adding new content, but your best nostalgia punch comes from Time Locked Progression (TLP) servers. There, the cities are populated and you can run around all those old areas you loved. Game is still fun after nearly 20 years. So, that's saying something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061740176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 271, 'playtime_forever': 2810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2810, 'last_played': 1631399433}
review:
This is where steam really needs a "neutral" button. This is the game that started MMOs as we know them today. It's well-developed and has some very fun things about it, but it's also very dated, clunky, and the new player experience is very bad. It's a very mixed bag. If you've played it before and want to play it again I wholeheartedly recommend it. But if you're a brand new player I'd avoid it unless you're out of MMOs to try.

This video showcases my first impressions followed by a Pros/Cons list to help you better understand my thoughts: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=98gyo2S9WG8

author: {'steamid': '76561198312252407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1581, 'last_played': 1633408606}
review: Absolutely, not only the First MMORPG, but it has always been a great game. So many copycats out there but they can't beat EQ.  I started when the game first game out in 1999, and though I may leave once in awhile, I always come back.  The customer service team not only found me original account but are always kind and courteous.  For as old as it is, graphics may not be top notch, but its the game play, the constant upgrades, and the endless expansions. Thank you EverQuest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119033125', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 178749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 269, 'playtime_at_review': 124003, 'last_played': 1710280439}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987418395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6351, 'last_played': 1644034705}
review: I began EQ when Ruins of Kunark first was released. Since then, over 15+ years, I have come back to EQ often. The changes are always extreme when you go years without touching a game. But the years gone, became a new experiance upon returning. Its been an ejoyable change, the thing that limited EQ was traveling to and from locations. Now its much easier, graphics are a bit more stable and the gameplay smoother. Its not as grindy in the sence you have no quests your actually doing. Now you can keep track and find actual quests to complete for loot and rewards. RNGesus eat your heart out. So for the new player, or returning old timer, this MMO is a good one to pick up. Youll not find children running amuck, youll find helpful norathians guiding you on your way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996902507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 95150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 163, 'playtime_at_review': 29595, 'last_played': 1711173470}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985865136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1602615709}
review:
If you want to play a very very early MMORPG, one that is basically text based with rudimentary 3d graphics , then this is your game. It's the game that was the hit before World of Warcraft took centerstage. 

I don't like this game, but I would recommend it if you were looking for that sort of game.

review: I have loved this game since 1999.....Still play it 22 years later. That says something to the quality of this game. It's FREE to play for the most part, and if you love MMO's, this is one of the OG's of the genre. I will play this game until the devs shut it down and force me to stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069397898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3835, 'last_played': 1693209304}
review:
Great old school MMO.

If you've played Final Fantasy XI, then you know what you're getting into with this game.

Grindy. Long, drawn out quests with little direction. Death penalties. Needing to actually talk to NPC's instead of just grab and go. Slow leveling (especially in the later levels). Boat rides that take around 15 minutes. The list goes on.

In short, if you're wanting something closer to Dungeons and Dragons 2nd edition as opposed to 5th, then this is the game you should pick up. It's fantastic, if you have the patience to learn its systems and immerse yourself in its world. Not even the old graphics hold it back in my opinion, as playing it is like stepping into a time capsule back when dial up was a thing.

If any of those the above sound boring, aggravating, or monotonous, then I would advise staying away. This game demands you put in time in order to progress, and it doesn't care about your feelings. Personally, it's part of the draw, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962089406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1624603411}
review:
This game is so different from what I remember playing when it first came out. Character creation was severely limited and you started in some strange prison zone that I don't recall being there when I first played this game.

I wanted to just jump in and have a bit of nostalgia but what I got was something else that totally ruined my experience. You start in some prison hole/mine shaft kind of thing and there's nothing to explore. You have to go and slowly, and I do mean SLOOOOOWLY, kill monsters in order to get out. But this was so boring and tedious that I couldn't make it past this. It just wasn't worth my time. At least in other MMOs you start in a city and can wonder around. What caused the devs to make this design choice I can't say but it's awful.

Honestly I don't think this game is anything close to what it was and is so much worse than it ever was back in the early '00s so I can't recommend this game for anyone and actually recommend against anyone playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026897035', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 102390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 913, 'last_played': 1694098896}
review:
When Everquest was in Verants hands it was the best game on the planet, hardcore MMO'ing that forced you to make friends/alliances if you wanted to go far in the game. 

72 man raids that took over an hour to kill one boss and took prolific planning and execution to complete by all in the raid. 

The worst thing to happen to it was the casualisation, marking the beginning of the end of those fantastic days.

 Sadly, a trait that most MMO's adopt today and ever since. 

Great things about EverQuest:


1) Long travel times and death penalties
2) Group dungeon crawling and community building
3) Newbies and casuals admiring the Hardcores and their special loot/armor look

Zero instant gratification, and the scope just seemed epic.  The first trip across the Karanas.  Or looking off the boat and seeing the Cyclops trouncing around their island.  You just felt small.

I also enjoyed that minor things had major meaning depending on level.  Still remember trading a SSB that was given to me by a warrior in the top raiding guild on Innoruuk.  It was from their SSOY farm, and I traded it for my first PGT.  He gave me one to wear and one to sell because he had a pack full of them.  Always ended up with 27 helms and a single sword it seemed.

Sydsloot Halflingpunter, 50 Barbarian Warrior...guy seemed like a god to me as a lo 20's scrub inspecting him to see the best gear available in vanilla.

OK, I really enjoyed camping guards. Don't know why  :lol: perhaps it was the good XP or getting to help newbies when they run to their guards and find them dead. As a mage I could usually help them with their trains, and buffing them was fun for me. Not everyday a mage feels useful  :D 

So here is my list of guards killed.

Steamfont: Gnome guards were plentiful and decent money.

Misty Thicket: Guards along the wall, had lowbie druids cast lull so I could easily break the spawn

Neriak 3rd Gate: all of the wandering guards near the floating eye.

Thurgadin: Had to chain cast my earth pet at lvl 55 to kill one of them. not worth the XP, but you do get a cool shield.

Erudin: Don't remember where in Erudin but I remember he used LH, which sucked.

Qeynos Hills: Random guards, just for fun.

Butcherblock: Many dwarf guards, little ankle bitters can put up a fight.

Heck, anything that moved that I could kill I tried to. Just to see what it dropped. I had some horrible faction problems, but it was all worth it. I loved the freedom to make such decisions. God I love this game!

I did a little nostalgia run of this, recently. Teleported myself to Qeynos and played it just like it was back then, without any of the new content, from scratch. It was a blast. Got to level 30ish. The immersion of this game is so good, because it demands so much of you. It demands you to become one with the game, and that's what makes it so cool. Learn your environment or get lost, type to the NPC's or be clueless, pay attention or get killed, be a detective or learn nothing of the world you are experiencing, train your character or suck at everything, pay attention to factions or get killed. It's an explorer's dream world.

Compare that to WoW or Elder Scrolls Online, which I've been playing. These new MMO's just feel like a fancy backdrop with some chores available. A place to go and hang out and do something, even if it's not anything particularly memorable. I don't feel any atmosphere, I don't feel any danger, I don't feel any immersion. It's not a virtual world, it's just a virtual stage by comparison.

Everquest managed to make such an immersive experience that it really feels like a second world. There's enough depth to it, to really capture the imagination. I'd say it's still one of the best MMO's around, even if people don't understand it these days. They expect games to tell them what to do and where to go, and that's just not how EQ works. Culture shock, basically.

Be glad we experienced a zeitgeist, my dudes. Nobody will ever experience Everquest again, because the times have changed, and even if they see it, they won't know what they are seeing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013499158', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3465, 'last_played': 1695154559}
review:
This is EverQuest in all it's decade spanning glory. It was my first MMO starting way back in 1999, and continued to be a year post launch of World of Warfcraft. While I ended up putting it down for other games, once it went Free to Play I jumped right back in. 

It's a huge hit of nostalgia hiding a huge depth of new stuff that's been added since I last played. I can revisit my old hunting grounds and then move on to see areas completely new. If you're a fan of old school MMOs, from the days when MUDs were the norm and graphics were new, you won't want to miss out on this title. Give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198134595070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1625843216}
review: Everquest was the first real game addiction i made.It became so fun to be social or not.So many options .It was such a great game and still is.Everquest has been around for 2 decades and there is a reason for that.Gotta love the sand giants and begging or paying or making heavy coin off the spell breeze which only a level 16 enchanter can cast and makes your magic mana regenrate like 20 times faster.I used to get 10pp per cast of breeze.This game is nothing but great memories and allnight gaming fun.Im very happy to have supported it and have been a member for years..EVERQUEST 4 EVER....

author: {'steamid': '76561198087674537', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1625057812}
review:
This game was awesome 17 years ago. Last time I played was 16 years ago. Having returned after 16 years, I now remember why I had stopped playing it. 

If you had not played Everquest in 1999, then do not bother playing this game. Graphics, mechanics, gameplay are awful. But if you are a veteran EQ player, loging back into Norrath will certainly bring back good memories. 

With the launch of WOW, I had migrated to WOW and today, it still is the best MMMO ever. Graphics, gameplay, the story and mechanics are awesome. So if you are after nostalgia, go for WOW instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561199182021316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1625787191}
review: when trying to play again after logging out eqgame.exe takes over my entire screen after selecting a server. although i can still access windows bar, nothing except resetting my pc allows the moving/closing of the non responsive game. it seems this very common bug comes from logging out of the game and isnt always the same for everyone. but if you /camp desktop and restart your pc when you log out, you can prevent this bug. By deleting  eqclient.ini and eqlsclient.ini when this bug happens then restart your pc, ive had 100% success in fixing this issue.

review: EverQuest is one of the all time greats in the MMORPG genres.  Unlike modern MMO's it is hard enough to need to work with other players and although frustrating at times, its also very rewarding. If you are a fan of MMOs and you have not tried EverQuest, jump into one of the Time Lock Progression servers which is regularly very populated and very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997537239', 'num_games_owned': 734, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 10399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2775, 'last_played': 1626562383}
review: Sometimes, you just need to go back to simpler times and simpler games. I honestly feel like there's more appeal to classic EQ1 than just nostalgia, though. I think it holds up. Sure, it's nowhere near as complex as modern MMOs, but the gameplay is still fun, and sometimes it just feels really soothing to grind out some experience at a camp for an hour or two without needing to put too much thought into anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986822982', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6735, 'last_played': 1706933550}
review: Iconic MMO that set the standard and was the precursor for many MMO's for a decade.  Dated graphics, but rich gameplay, storyline, and community.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998598944', 'num_games_owned': 2056, 'num_reviews': 1145, 'playtime_forever': 12639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4438, 'last_played': 1659418176}
review:
So this game has a lot of nostalgia for me.  I enjoy playing it because it brings me back to 1999.  This review isn't for me though, because if you REALLY LIKE EverQuest, you'll probably not read reviews and you'll just download and replay it.

This review is for people who have never played EverQuest.

The good of EverQuest: 
[list]
    [*]The game has a ton of content.
    [*]The game requires grouping.  If you like playing MMOs in a group this game is great.
    [*]This game doesn't hold your hand.  If you like doing quests there's a lot to discover, possibly years of content.
[/list]

The bad about EverQuest
[list]
    [*]They have never updated the UI, if you have a 2K monitor you will have trouble reading text.  There are some UI mods to fix some of this but they are challenging to find and are still not perfect.
    [*]The game is slow.  If you have a lot of time to play this isn't a problem.  But if you only have 30 minutes you might as well not log in because you will not get anything done.
    [*]The game revolves around camping.  Which is finding a good spot, and someone in your party pulls to your spot, and you kill stuff in the same place for literally hours.  This is because casters get more mana back by sitting.  This is fine if you are with friends and are enjoying each other's company.  If you are with untalkative strangers it can be a drag.  This can be a good game to watch Netflix with... if that sounds fun.
    [*]Some people play EverQuest as a solo character.  This is strange to me because you would have to judge EverQuest versus other single player RPGs.  Comparing the fun of soloing in EverQuest to "soloing" Skyrim or Dark Souls is silly. This game is a strange choice for solo players.
[/list]

Overall as much as I look back on my memory of EverQuest with fondness, and I call myself a MMO fan.  I think I've just outgrown the game and perhaps outgrown the genre as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026430933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1624335291}
review:
Scam

The original game is fine, Everquest is great if you're looking to play. But the new owners are worse than Sony. Sad that one of the biggest, original MMO IPs is now owned by a company that is a downright scam. Lootboxes are the icing on the cake. Lost 30 dollars because of "an error" and can only get it back in their "dollars" for games I don't play. I'll take the loss and move on but be careful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008388599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6908, 'last_played': 1624215049}
review: If you are old-school (or better yet, played Everquest back in the day), this is a great nostalgia boost. It is easier to play now, with plenty of quality-of-life improvements. With over two dozen expansions, there is a LOT of content to enjoy, even if you are just soloing. If you want to group and eventually guild-raid, there is even more.  As far as the free-to-play goes, there isn't much reason to pay for the first 50 levels or so, as long as you only want to try one or two characters. If you enjoy it enough at that point to want more out of the game, the subscription isn't huge and can be worth the enhanced fun factor, but don't start with it. Consider the first 50 hours+ as a VERY extended demo...

author: {'steamid': '76561198932621446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1620872167}

review:
its a walk down memory lane, i used to be really big into this game back in high school and loved the enchanter class I started a new one and fell in love again.  Its a bit different for some of the old school players, but retains enough of the magic to bring you back for at least a little while. 

Now it still plays like an older mmorpg, thats important because many of us are used to quest trails and quick game play by now, there are still camps here, and its the long game not the ultra faced paced world some may have gotten used to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250828862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 153002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88449, 'last_played': 1654714345}
review: I was an original EQer and it was my first real MMO. I will always have fond memories of this franchise, and am happy that after 22 years it is still running! It was seriously mismanaged by first Verant/SOE, then Daybreak Games, and has been split and sold once again. However,  due to the dedication of many employees, the game has survived. I often wish that a new version of the game would come along to shock the world, however after the EQNext disaster, it looks doubtful. I will always yo-yo back to classic MMORPGs like Everquest and Wow. There are no games like the classics! Give them a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561199092381655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1618345314}
review: Never have I been graced quite so much in my short, limited and terrible life to play a game quite as horrible, yet amazingly nostalgic as Ever Quest.  This game lets me reminisce on a time that my generation, (Generation Z), barely experienced, a time in video game history filled with terrible MMO's, an N64 thumb stick that tried to penetrate my palm blisters, and that one Tony Hawk game on PS1.  Ever Quest is filled with one of the most diverse communities of gamers ranging from the average facebook mom who just wants to play to cast pretty spells and chat with people online, to the angry basement gaming warrior who's level 1000 and has been playing for 10 years, to people like me who just want to play because we watched Sword Art Online and thought it was cool.  This game is plagued with in game purchases of nearly all kinds, glitches of nearly all kinds, one of the worst combat systems iv'e ever used, a terrible UI, a confusing key layout, etc., but it's still one of the most endearing, captivating games I have ever known.  Every single step taken in the massive open world of Ever Quest will almost undoubtedly be accompanied by terrible pain, regret, anger, frustration, misery, and uncontrollable rage, but also satisfaction, satisfaction in knowing that a snake does less damage than a bunny, satisfaction in knowing you somehow let yourself drown when your air level takes four minutes to fully drain, satisfaction in dying to a difficult enemy because the frame rate dropped when this game only requires 2 gigabytes of ouRAM to run.  I recommend this game.  P.S. did you know that velveeta cheese is actually a ninja from the ocean.  Don't tell your mom.  I'll be twerking on my only fans, (Daddy's Passion), please go there because i'll give you a free subscription if you give me a job.  I'm really down in the dumps right now.  Iv'e been on the corner edging guys off for fiddy money and i'm straight.

review: Game is a great time-sink and nostalgia farm. Unfortunately it is full of botters, RMTers, hackers and the like - which somehow never get penalized, yet regular players, such as myself, who have never used any of these programs suddenly find themselves permanently banned for 'third party programs' immediately after purchasing 80 dollars worth of p2w crap from their website with no actual response besides a canned bot response to the ban appeal which states that they do not make mistakes and the ban is un-appeal-able. Twenty Four year veteran of this IP and I cannot recommend it with their new dev team and the way they've turned it into a cash milking scam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183909610', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 12035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1425, 'last_played': 1701835555}
review:
EQ is literally the same game as it always was. Heavy on group and raid content. Hard on solo players. They added some new game mechanics in the past 10yrs which makes it more interesting and does help somewhat if your trying to play solo. They revamped a few of the zones which makes it interesting to say the least but makes you feel somewhat displaced all at the same time. With all the expansions that the game has to offer you will never be bored since there will always be something to do.

The biggest piece of advise I can give someone that is looking at this game is this: If you play well by being creative and finding things to do on your own or make friends easily in an online setting this game is for you. If you are shy and need to rely on a group you should pass on this one. Also as a side note the customer service hasn't changed much....if your having issues with the daybreak website try internet explorer..chrome is buggy with their site and wont do anything but frustrate you. Be patient with the tickets..Im on day 2 waiting for account recovery issues with no clear end in sight. Good luck!

author: {'steamid': '76561198138830482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1616349270}
review:
I've been playing EverQuest since "Open Beta" 1998.
Met a lot of really great people from all around the world.
Had a lot of fun Raiding, but my best memories are from the long, slow grinds with close friends.

Highly recommend. Especially if you like to chat and want a game with literally Infinite Lore / Story line.

They are still adding more to this very day!

Happy 22nd Anniversary EverQuest!

~Heather oxoxo

author: {'steamid': '76561198098617620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1665462563}
review:
Daybreak/Darkpaw games it not a reputable company. If you bring up any of there shady practices(such as bait and switch tactics) on their forums you get banned. I highly recommend not touching this game unless:

A. You do no care that the current management team has little respect for the player base

B. You are willing to fork out hundreds of dollars to have multiple active accounts to box to make any progress in this game. Everyone plays multiple accounts at once and no one groups much any more.  The rate of progression solo will make it nearly impossible to be current unless you devote most of your free time to it. 

C. You love micro transactions. This is the largest Pay to Win model ive ever experienced.  

D. You do not care about pvp, While it exists, the Developers are actively hostile and rude to the Pvp community. 

F. The Devs have favoritism  big time. From the forums to what they let some players get away with, its a 2 tiered system. 

The game itself was amazing, but nearly everyone I know that has moved on from Everquest did so because of the people running the game. Ive never experienced these issues with any other game or MMO before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007586125', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 151653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115229, 'last_played': 1707918708}
review:
If you Grew up on EQ and/or messed with P99 then you understand the game. Not much of the basics has changed. 

New players: EQ is a very Detailed and Old School game that will not hold your hand and will severely punish you if you do not read or pay attention. There are many websites for valuable information for quests & items in the game and their various uses, so search search search, nearly everything has a use somewhere or somehow. Ask general chat for help as most will give it to you, just don't beg for stuff!

!!!!!!!!!! WARNING !!!!!!!!!!

With much trial and error, of using the Daybreak installer and the steam installer, if the game is run with Steam it will not work. Clicking on the launcher manually in the Steam directory ran the game fine though. Unsure what is opened when started through steam but it will throw an error when loading into the world. I'm sure someone smarter than me will be able to add the right run arguments to fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035345202', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 24617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 78, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1711078113}
review:
I've played EverQuest off and on since 1999. To say that it was a groundbreaking or genre-defining game is understating it. EverQuest created an entire genre, introduced an entirely new array of players to fantasy RPG games, and set the standard by which games of its type are developed. And this is very much true to this day.

But this is not the EverQuest that you knew and loved in 1999, 2000, 2001. That EverQuest is gone. Verant interactive no longer exists. Sony Online Entertainment is now Daybreak Games. And Daybreak Games owns EverQuest. The closest thing that we have for classic EverQuest is Project 1999 (P99). If you want classic EverQuest, P99 is the way. If you miss EverQuest as it was in the early post-classic years, then the best that we have for it is The Al Kabor Project (TAKP).

Modern EverQuest isn't the same as it was. The game has changed, the player has changed, and the company has changed. Daybreak Games has done some good things and some bad things to try and keep up with the evolving MMORPG scene. But honestly? I'm genuinely glad that Daybreak Games is still working on EverQuest.

EQ can still be a lot of fun. The first 6-12 months of a time-locked progression (TLP) server will remind you a lot of how it used to be. You can still explore most of your old favorite zones on the standard servers as well, with AI mercenary sidekicks or a small group of friends. And if you stick it out, you might find yourself surprised that the newest content is actually quite fun. Again, unless you go into it expecting EQ the way you remembered it. You level faster now. Some things have been streamlined, or made "easier." Your jaw will drop at how easy it is to get great equipment and weapons at low levels.

EQ is an evolved beast.

Pros:
+ An incredible amount of content and lore (23 years of content!)
+ Some of the most unique and fun classes in the genre (e.g., necromancer)
+ The old character models still hold so much charm (you literally can't deny this)
+ Most of your favorite zones and favorite enemies are still there (the new Freeport is terrible though)
+ Your original characters are probably still around, and customer service is really great at restoring old accounts (I got 20+ year old characters back!)
+ The TLP servers are still a great bit of fun, if you don't stress to hit max level in the first few days.
+ The standard servers that you remember do not require a subscription, and old accounts were upgraded to "Silver" (more character slot) status a few years ago.
+ The subscription price is basically still the same as it has always been.

Cons:
- Some of the "new" (original Luclin) models are derpy as heck, and that hasn't been improved.
- The default UI is still bad. (But Daybreak is apparently modernizing the UI through the next 6-12 months.)
- Some of the newer zones are really bad. (Again, the new Freeport is perhaps the worst.)
- There is a cash shop in the game now, and there are some "pay to win" items (e.g., experience boost potions) in the game.
- Some of the mounts and player illusions are really immersion breaking. (I try to avoid them as much as possible.)
- On regular servers, most of the lower level zones are dead, except the tutorial. This can be great though, if you like to solo or "molo" (solo + AI mercenary).
- There are a more boxers in the game now, than what you would have remembered from 20 years ago. It's not so bad on standard servers, but it sucks hard on the TLP servers during the first few weeks.

All that being said -- it's still an incredible gaming experience, with a history and legacy rivaled only by World of Warcraft. Unless you insist on original zones and a gameplay feel as close to classic EverQuest as possible, you may find modern EverQuest to be a lot of fun.

My Rating:
C+ for this version of EverQuest on live servers.
B- for this version of EverQuest on TLP servers.
B+ for the TAKP version of EverQuest
A- for the Project 1999 version of EverQuest.

Recommendation? You know what to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248329946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1613507111}
review:
Oof, listed as free to play. Is not Free to Play. 

If you were looking to scratch that old EQ itch, Day Break has ruined the new player experience. First, everyone apparently starts in a Tutorial Zone. Honestly, I was kind of hoping to log in, explore around the Erudite City some, then make the run to another starting zone. Second, there are shopping features all over the UI from character creation to actual buttons on the HUD in game. 

I'm mainly against this being labeled as "Free to Play" on steam, when obviously it's not. It needs to be labeled as Micro-transactions at least. But thanks to that really bad 30 minute experience I felt compelled to write this review, uninstall, and delete that account I just made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073792514', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 87071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10795, 'last_played': 1709959457}
review:
This is such a great game. I played EQ for about 5 years when it came out and then  bounced from MMO to MMO. Now I'm back full circle and I'm having a blast. Building a character from the ground up in such a deep a rich way  is something I really missed. Once you start figuring EQ out--it has a high learning curve--the game becomes another world. A world so easy to get lost in that the game use to be nicknamed EverCrack. 

Where the game really shines above others in how natural it is to group up.  Finding a group that is not in a dungeon or a raid is easy.  Each class has so much utility or purpose that you are likely to be wanted somewhere if you ask. 

Trying to pick a new main but  love the Bard, Cleric, warrior, shaman and wizard so much. Playing 9 different classes at once and really like them all. I'm leaning wizard but would not be surprised if that changed. You can get lost for hours just finding stuff and figuring things out. The coolest part of being back is knowing that  I have just scratched the surface so far and it already feels deep.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960778532', 'num_games_owned': 467, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 5265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3492, 'last_played': 1683064962}

author: {'steamid': '76561198380380674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 171188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 143180, 'last_played': 1711143018}
review:
Dear You, please don’t play Everquest ever again, unless you’re going to play project 1999.
Everquest live is a botting money pit, you will buy a krono and sell it to someone and then buy the prog/PL/or gear from the person that bought the krono from you. The economy is controlled by a handful of very hardcore players, the devs can’t keep up with the game, the server lag is immense and loading times are ridiculous. The new “content” being put out now is a copy of the older zones but with much less work and no heart. (EoK to ToL so far). The only reason the game is still alive is because if people buying krono and Bags on the TLP’s. the TLP’s only last for 4-5 months and then a new one comes out. So that DB can keep selling bags and krono. DB doesn’t care about your player experience, they care about your wallet. Enough of grinding away on the same 3 camps for 300 hours at a time. Your done.  Even the casual end game scene is ass. All you will be doing is joining someone’s box and AFKing half the times because their 3rd party software has coded their cleric to heal better than you can.
The game is FULL to the brim with boxers, it’s the only way a lot of players can get the loot and XP they want. They main a Shadow Knight, and have 5 others boxed classes that do all the damage and healing for them, its literally cheating, but DB doesn’t care because that boxer is paying for 5 subscriptions. 
Botting/boxing brings me to another point. Some people sell “power levels” and charge by the hour. I myself have boughten a few hours of power leveling and all it is, is a botte raid group farming the same mobs as they respawn. The “player” owning the botted toons doesn’t even have to look at his monitor.
Ive group with raid geared healers that “go auto pilot” while afk and heal the group fine because of 3rd party botting software . THE GAME IS FULL OF BOXERS AND BOTTING CHEATERS, THE ECONOMY IS FUCKED AND SO IS THE SERVER LAGD. DB will be spitting out re runs of old expansions and the servers cant take it anymore. Goodbye Everquest live, empires of kunark to terror of luclin. 2,800 hours of grind and telling myself the game isn’t dead. Spending so much money on krono and cosmetics to eventually feel unsatisfied again and again. Its been real and its been good but it hasn’t been real good. The only part of Everquest that is alright to play is the TLP server's that arn't free to play, they dont allow boxing and botting, even though the economy is somewhat janky because of krono. if your gonna play Daybreak games everquest play the TLP's and stay far away from the live servers

author: {'steamid': '76561197971297806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 11145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1683836298}
review: old school mmorpg still has all the charms and great  group play

author: {'steamid': '76561198054090663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 222884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221872, 'last_played': 1676588024}
review:
Still by far the best MMORPG that was ever made and designers around the world need to hang there heads in shame that no MMORPG ever got close to solving the end game problems that blight every single MMORPG ever made, with this the only exception.

This game continued to challenge you with the superb AA system (technically it meant level's went past 15,000 plus) along with the multitude of challenging raids and locked flagging progression zones and raids you had to continue to do once you did reach max level (having 2 seperate xp bars unlock at 51 was a masterstroke, since copied, but not to the extent EQ advanced it!)

If Everquest ever had a issue it was purely that it was TO daunting for people to ever try to get into with simply far to much content and incredibly crude early world zones (and UI!!)  that were'nt ever brushed up making them look horrendously bad, when the actual end game zones stand up pretty well to more modern MMO's (certainly some the character and monster models are pretty decent in EQ, although backdrops in general VERY poor).

It's never been beaten as any hardened MMORPG veteran will tell you, and i don't think it ever will on pure content, design and depth, as well as challenge, and truthfully it never will. 

This game will likely never truly ever die as it truly is one of a kind, anyone who did'nt like it never could of played it for longer than 6 month's which truly was how long you had to play it to truly actually understand what a gem it was (or simply is a GFX's fan boy and not really a true MMORPGer)

A clear 10 out of 10 game and well deserving of it's title to all true MMORPG'ers of the one that started it all and the grandaddy of all MMORPG's. 

Take a bow Everquest 1 every pound I spent of the roughly just over 1,000 i spent on this game was worth it.

My playtime incidentally on this game was around 9,000 hours i never got it on Steam till far more recently.(started in 1999 till 2013 and returned in 2016 till 2019 on progression server)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034334205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 32370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9826, 'last_played': 1679631931}
review:
This was once a great game. I've spent many, many hours enjoying this game in the past, but sadly it is but a shell of it's former self. Be prepared to crash when zoning which will prompt -- as customer service will direct you to do -- the deletion of files then a validating step and HOPE that fixes it. Sometimes it will, other times it won't for no good reason. Oh and if you don't "Return Home" when you try it log in, the problem could start all over again. So if it took you a half hour to run to where you crashed, luck you...you get to do it all over again. Also watch out for terrain bugs too where you get stuck in an invisible wall that will force you to /rewind or gate because you tried to go over a hill instead of around it.

The current owners of the game seem uninterested in fixing any of these issues leaving their customers to deal with their sloppy job.

I'd come back after years off because I really loved this game, but I'm leaving once more because it's just not worth my time and energy to put up with the mess it has become.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078809296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1691650947}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969787517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 74215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44395, 'last_played': 1708661381}
review: Everquest created by FAR the best gaming years of my life.  With quests that you actually had to think about, no map markers (you even need 3rd party software to even have maps, or make your own in game), more complex party mechanics than the simplistic holy trinity.  I never felt better playing any other online game.  20+ years after it's release, the FREE version will entertain you for quite a while and they've streamlined things and added help in the form of AI mercenaries to help you out as the current game is majority populated towards the end game.  Now for the good part, if you want to pay the monthly subscrition $15/month (which gives you premium access to ALL Daybreak games i.e. EQ2, planetside 2, and a couple more i think).  This is where you can get on PROGRESSION SERVERS.  The servers have different rule-sets, the one i recently played on started at base game and released expansions every 3 months in order.  It truly takes you right back to the hay-day of the game! Jam packed servers filled with willing group members all leveling at the pace you are.  Truly wonderful times even recently.  The latest progression server (that i played on) however featured 2-4 hour wait times no matter the time of day to get on.  This was the only problem i've had with this game in 20 years and it had a good effect on ruining the experience for me.  I will forever love this game and as far as i'm concerned, there isn't one better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963339246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 31075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5953, 'last_played': 1672701283}
review:
I played Everquest from 2002 to 2010, quite heavily. Then I got married and we both stopped playing video games and had kids. Now 10 years have gone by, tried other video games, nothing quite matches Everquest. Today, we are going on week 2 of coming back to the game. A lot has changed, but we are enjoying it.

They have removed some parts of the time sink, but it is still a huge time killer. Be warned, it will eat up a great amount of your time, it doesn't have the greatest graphics, but the depth of this game is more than any other game period and the community is huge. I thought it was dead, but my characters, from 10 years ago, were still there and there are nearly 1 million players still active.

A new expansion just came out this month.

review: 这款游戏我建议不要玩了首先他封锁中国的IP地址你用梯子注册帐号之后用梯子玩了一阵子这个游戏第二天我再打开这个游戏的时候，他把我整个邮箱给封了明显就是，不想让国人玩家玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198288058950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2721, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1709305142}
review:
Основная проблема с этой игрой заключается в том, что если у вас нет действительно сильной гильдии, готовой помочь вам, у вас не будет шансов получить достойное снаряжение, все названные лагеря заняты 24/7 людьми, боксирующими в токсичных гильдиях, которые просто заберут лагеря у вас, если Вам посчастливилось их получить. из-за этого они оказывают абсолютное господство над игровой экономикой, взимая безумные цены на снаряжение, которое должно быть разумно доступным, и удивляют и удивляют лагеря, которые могут принести вам деньги, взяты людьми, которые боксируют 24/7.

Все это на платных серверах премиум-класса, на которых должны быть установлены правила против токсичного и оскорбительного поведения, а бокс запрещен, но никогда не применяется.

Было весело вернуться на какое-то время, но когда реальность доходит до того, как токсичные игроки без надзора со стороны GM испортили эту игру, вы бросаете и возвращаетесь в ожидании Пантеона.

review: I'm scared of playing this game.  Any time I return, I swear I'll only play one account, and casually at that.  Fast forward three weeks and I'm 6-boxing and paying monthly subs on all of the accounts.  This game is insidious and life-ruining while still being amazing after 20 years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091510109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1043, 'last_played': 1606331907}
review: There are problems with this game that might not be fixable at this point.  The huge number of servers might be partly to blame though.  It's just so -empty- in there.  The tutorial was somewhat populated so I was encouraged at first, but when I left there it all just kept going downhill.  I picked a recommended server, so there should have been people, but I hardly saw anyone, even in the starting town.  And the starting town was a huge disappointment.  Partly because a big part of the charm and nostalgia of EQ is the fact that everyone used to choose a starting town and it  became your home, and the towns were so far apart, every race got to have a different experience 'growing up' before going out into the world.  And there lies the second disappointment.  The new starting town seems to be the place to be, where all the quests are, all the action.  From what I saw, you don't have to go beyond that one zone for at least half a character's leveling life.  I went out into the world, visited a few of my favorite old zones and towns and I saw no one, not a single player out there, I saw no evidence of updates to loot or quests.  It was all like the old EQ where you were ecstatic to get a +2WIS ring at level 10, while the new -newbie- armor that I got in the tutorial had stats like +5 to ALL on a hat.  Meaning all those old quests where you went on a long difficult journey for epic loot are now long difficult journeys for useless trash.  Takes the fun out of it.  Plus even that starting town was kinda empty, it's like everyone quits in disappointment after the tutorial, which is what I'm about to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030753610', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 125024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32845, 'last_played': 1642431364}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969875492', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 36863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21679, 'last_played': 1708314146}
review:
The original 3d Graphic based MMORPG. 21+ Years strong and still trailblazing new content! Brad McQuaid is looking down with a smile for that first project that put him on the map and in the minds of all early mmo addicts. There is no denying the power of this game and its ability to suck you into completely a different reality. Unlike most modern linear mmos that seem to shy away from social interaction, or are just plain toxic by design Eq does a good job keeping a middle ground promoting friendships, relationships and yes even enemies bred from competition towards world wide firsts.

This is not to mention the plethora of time locked progression servers serving up every era of eq possible so you can relive it or play it live as current content. Come join the fun Daybreak and Darkpaw have done so much with the title. I can't wait to see the next 20 years :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198048827432', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 47873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47677, 'last_played': 1603831573}
review:
EQ was good in the old days and still is good. It is not so a timesick while levelling up, but still almost the same raid mobs and quest as in the old days. Nothing changed here a lot. Most quests are pretty stupid or a total timesink(eg. epic, etc.).

Still if u have quite some time and played EQ, try and enjoy it on a TLP, quite a challenge. Solo in this game is mostly impossible after lvl 20, mobs do a lot of melee damage and if u are twinked or have ultra good gear, it is more viable in a group from 4 to 6 members.

I still like it tho i am waiting for another game to be released in future it is a good time killer during rainy days.

review:
EverQuest is nice to play, but you really need a computer that can make it sing!
I recently built an X99-TF 12 Core 24 thread Zeon mobo and overclocked it to 3.6Ghz, with 32 GB PC3 12800 RAM and a Radeon RX 5500 XT Graphics card. I've also got a 57 Cord GPU 16X PCIe card that I'm pulling out of storage to add to the mix. I know the RX 5500 XT isn't the greatest graphic card, but it does Crysis respectably!
So, I'm looking forward to working this puppy out tonight!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981847122', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 275062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88739, 'last_played': 1701201080}

author: {'steamid': '76561198166627148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1683852498}
review: Everquest is one of the original mmo's that completely changed the world.  While there was a few before it, none captured peoples minds and attention like this game did.  The challenge to stay alive at young age is one of the most difficult of any rpg and while many complained it was TOO hard, herein lies the truth.  The difficulty did not ruin the game, it made all the more rewarding when you did finish a long quest or finally get that epic you camped for an entire month. In games like Warcraft, epic weapons drop on the Ground, while instantly gratifying for a few fleeting moments, it never gives you the satisfaction of feeling like you went on an adventure to get it. In everquest, you get that sense,  and the challenge is what makes the game so much more rewarding than any game before or after.  The graphics may be old and cheesy, but there is a long wealth of class and race options and endless ways you can build your character around a certain weapoin and playstyle., The long quests, the absolute terror you feel running from Freeport to Qeynos as a human who cant see in the dark almost gives it a horror movie like suspense.  Games today coddle players and give them everything they want in an instant, but cheers to good ol everquest for despite some coddling, is still one of the hardest rpg out there, and gosh darn it, we like it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008507018', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1621112445}
review: En su tiempo jugué muchos años y he de decir que es la mejor comunidad española en un mmo, nos dejabamos las cuentas para matar a ciertas horas boses, teniamos acceso a todo lo de todos y habia confianza, ahora es impensable con los juegos de hoy en dia, la jugabilidad es increible cuando formas parte de una guild buena y que haga raids para matar jefes, pero ahora sinceramente no vale la pena, dejo de ser Sony la que llevaba el cotarro para ser otra que lleva cientos de juegos de esta clase, lo recomiendo como experiencia en un mmo real y que en todo momento sientes que te van a matar y peligras en cualquier zona por muy nivel bajo que sea, el subir de nivel es lento pero sientes que te curras el personaje, y el llevar una arma de un jefe en concreto hace vale la guild en la que estas y el personaje que llevas, no todo el mundo tiene acceso a armas o armaduras buenas de jefes que necesitan de jugadores involucrados y atentos en una raid, un personaje puede ser unico por lo que lleva vestido y sabes que la guild en la que esta es buena.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970807526', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 22665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6739, 'last_played': 1608568974}
review: Not sure how many hours I actually have on this game, but I did play this back in high school when it was released. I recently got back into the game but playing on one of the new progression servers (Aradune) and the community there is really nice, I've had a few players come by and donate gear or platinum (in-game currency) to help me out. I got one of my best friends to join me, and she and I play all the time. You do need a subscription in order to play on the progression servers, but I highly recommend playing on them because they start with some of the first expansion packs and over time they will release the other expansions. I think Shadows of Luclin will be available to play in February 2021.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025837006', 'num_games_owned': 985, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3434, 'last_played': 1709481367}
review:
Daybreak quit opening my browser.

I don't mind the in game reminders or anything else in program, but opening tabs in my browser is beyond not cool. I know its in the eula, tos, ect. It's still an invasive and shit thing to do. I've had this crap freeze my browser 3x now, not to mention any possible security issues it has the possibility of causing.

Just please stop, I really miss EQ and EQ 2 been playing since before I was in the army in 99 and it was still Verant, hell i still have my old cd jewelcase. Though I think that account went away with an old hacked email i cant even remember anymore, prolly an aol or some such, but I digress.

This seriously makes me cringe and not want to play, yes I know it's a petty reason but it's a petty tactic.

*side note* I have spent money in the games, I did so in EQ yesterday $35, So I do help support the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966970006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 20733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20733, 'last_played': 1522565604}
review: I started playing the original EQ when it was in beta a long time ago, long before WOW and most other MMORPG's, it has gone through a lot of changes since then, not all good, but passable is some respects and has been running ever since. EQ is the Father of MMOs and is where everyone should start. Its a bit dated in some areas but holds itself pretty well It can be a grind if you play from scratch but its still an enjoyable game after all these years.  Its worth giving it a go.

review: Still a solid MMO even after all these years. Although, you will have difficulty finding a group to do any content. Most people box or bot, leaving many players disenfranchised. If you find groups or get into an active guild it can still be a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007483106', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2946, 'last_played': 1600121031}
review:
I have played Everquest since 1999, 6 mouths after release.
Its still has the magic of EQ which every other MMORPG failed to copy.

In EQ, you do not want to die. You do whatever you can, NOT TO DIE.
Its the opposite of WoW =).

Even with the very old graphics, it still got its charm, and graphics doesnt matter if your core game mechanics are not good. Or the company gets bought to someone who put in a cash store.

Everquest still is the best MMORPG, because of it is hard to do stuff. And you loose levels if you die, etc.

Never played EQ?
Ok, Which one these do you prefer?

1. You loved WoW. How fast and good things where, how you could just que automaticly for groups and dont pay much attention.

2. You loved ESO, Conan, Eve, an open world that kicks your butt no matter how much you zerg.
And you enjoy working for your char where your personal skills in playing is a big factor.

Now,
If you are nr 1, stay FAAAAR away from Everquest!

If you like nr 2.
Download EQ now...

Maulkin of Dark Horizon, wizard in 2001.
Cogo Hatemachine, Guild founder, leader and raid leader 2002 - 2007

author: {'steamid': '76561197961913360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 68665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3445, 'last_played': 1701153074}
review: Legendary game! Long time player of EQ, started playing in the year 2000 and although I have been around the block when it comes to games, I always find myself coming back to this one. Graphics are outdated but the experience you get out of this game remains the same. In my opinion it is still the best MMO to date. Loads of content with 26 expansion packs. Even being a long time player there are certain places in the world I have never been and are still "scary" to me. Lots and lots of lore, if you are into it. A good list of classes and races to chose from. If you like playing solo there are classes in the game that can solo very well and a mercenary system where you can hire a tank, healer, or dps to help you out if need be. Great game to check out especially when its free to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198275493613', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1702573391}
review:
I've played the game since i was nine years old and long before it was ever on Steam. Start with Ruins of Kunark and stopped playing everquest as my main MMO with House of Thule.

The memories i have with this game are far, far, far to numerous to count. I am so glad to still be able to play this game. It still withstands the test of time.

Give it a shot. I can almost promise you wont regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969506478', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1689123710}
review:
EverQuest is a piece of gaming history that I believe players should experience.
However, it's important to note that the gameplay can feel quite limited.

Combat is the main focus of the game and everything you do is geared towards improving your combat skills.
While there are different ways to fight and different enemies to battle, at the end of the day, it's all about fighting.

Additionally, despite its name, there aren't many "quests" in the traditional sense.
Players will likely spend a significant amount of time engaging in repetitive combat.

Overall, while it's worth trying for historical value, players should not go in expecting a diverse gameplay experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966663962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13426, 'last_played': 1617780134}

author: {'steamid': '76561198105201448', 'num_games_owned': 1253, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2906, 'last_played': 1598957855}
review:
Für alle die die Herausforderung lieben, aber nicht den Stress und die toxische Umgebung vieler moderner MMOs.

Mehr Sandbox als Themepark, besonders auf den TLP Servern.

Ich habs wieder abonniert, weil ich auf einem TLP-Server spielen und dann langsam die Erweiterungen erarbeiten will. Auch wenn ich derzeit moch alleine spiele (als Nekro is das möglich) ist es eigentlich ein Spiel in dem es auf Zusammenspiel ankommt. Und es ist mit seinen langsamen Kampf und Regenerationssystem genial um mit anderen abzuhängen und "nebenher" zu spielen,

Mein Wermutstropfen: eine wrklich aktive deutsche Community konnte ich (auf Aradune) leider nicht mehr finden.
